nodes.bodyText: Style nitpick: a normal for each might be easier for debugging and reading
Lists.newArrayList doesn't really have any advantages anymore

There are bunch of alternatives that can be used here - new ArrayList() {{add(getIdeContext(context));}};, Arrays.asList(getIdeContext(context));, Stream.of(getIdeContext(context)).collect(Collectors.toList());, and new ArrayList<ContentAssistContext>(Arrays.asList(getIdeContext(context)));.
I would prefer using Arrays.asList(getIdeContext(context)); as it is less verbose. Would that be ok?
Oh nevermind I was wrong, keep it as it is
Not in an IDE right now, shouldn't this be a .equals?
is an enum.
I think you mentioned this before but this should probably be .equals
It is identity-comparison in the original code. PS - https://bit.ly/2J7otQR
I'd prefer a better name such as refactoringStatus or convertedSeverity
Ideally you use a RefactoringStatus constant instead of 0 as well
would be an api change !?!
I don't have an IDE handy, I'd hope one of the RefactoringStatus constants would be set to 0
The value of RefactoringStatus.OK is set to 0. I can initialize the local variable refactoringStatus (name changed) to  RefactoringStatus.OK and remove the case OK from the switch block.
s/weighting/weighing/
This slipped through.
Just return immediatly
You can just use "name".equals()
No need for Lists.newArrayList
unneeded final
Not needed
Not needed
THere's also Arrays.stream or Stream.array or something
@tivervac @szarnekow I have added the break here. The original code didn't have it. Please confirm if this is ok.
Seems fine to me
@szarnekow I have purposefully kept this import as I didn't want to pollute this class with the reflection code.
@szarnekow Replacing Pair with a Java equivalent would break the downstream code, which is why I kept it as it is.
@szarnekow Public API. I kept the reference to Procedure1 to avoid breaking the consumer.
